title: Hey guys, new to typography and would appreciate some help!
content:
Hey everyone, I recently have become serious about typography. I’ve always dabbled and kept up with foundries but just recently i’ve started to purchase some nicer fonts and over the last year have built quite a collection. Now i just throw all the fonts i get into my user/library/fonts and dont think about it again. Now my list is over populated and I would like to reorganize by foundry or font (ie: serif, sans, sript) i would like to know how you guys go about keeping your font list uncluttered. I downloaded fontxplorer X from linotype? not sure if this is the best tool or not, any help would be greatly appreciated. thanks for everything. Also is there a way to strip all additional fonts besides my original mac leopard system fonts, my list has become so unorganized!

 [‹ vector halftones?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207160654/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36306 "Go to previous forum topic") [Flash and cache ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207160654/http:/www.typophile.com/node/51244 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Jeremiah

comments.content: FontExplorer X and organizing it by sans serif, serif, display, etc., works for me.
